H0.text: Digestion is the process that describes how humans process and consume food, whose first two steps are ingestion and propulsion.

H1.text: Absorption is the process that describes how humans process and consume food, with ingestion and propulsion as its first two steps.

H2.text: Regeneration is the process in which ingestion and propulsion are the first two steps that describe how humans process and consume food.

H3.text: Respiration is the process in which ingestion and propulsion are the first two steps that describe how humans process and consume food.

A4.text: Digestion is separated into four steps: Ingestion: placing food into the mouth (entry of food in the digestive system), Mechanical and chemical breakdown: mastication and the mixing of the resulting bolus with water, acids, bile and enzymes in the stomach and intestine to break down complex chemical species into simple structures, Absorption: of nutrients from the digestive system to the circulatory and lymphatic capillaries through osmosis, active transport, and diffusion, and Egestion (Excretion): Removal of undigested materials from the digestive tract through defecation.

A5.text: Underlying the process is muscle movement throughout the system through swallowing and peristalsis.
